title: Ex-Jetstar boss' start-up Rokt raises $70m to delay IPO
text:
Rokt, the e-commerce marketing tech company founded by former Jetstar boss Bruce Buchanan, will remain privately owned for the forseeable future after raising $US48 million ($70 million) from Sydney-based global investors TDM Growth Partners.

Mr Buchanan said the raising, one of the largest local start-up rounds of the year, was undertaken not to fund Rokt's expansion plans but to allow early investors to sell down.

TDM Growth Partners' Tom Cowan and Rokt chief executive Bruce Buchanan met on the Guzman Y Gomez board.

"When you go public there is an opportunity cost ... the longer you hold off, the more you can focus on product and business growth," Mr Buchanan said.

"But you also have to be conscious of creating liquidity options for shareholders. This way you're creating most of the benefits of being public without the cost."

Rokt's product is aimed at letting e-commerce operators promote goods that are not selling as well, by creating personalised offers for complementary products after a customer has completed a transaction.
description: Bruce Buchanan's e-commerce marketing start-up has brought on a big funding round to allow early investors to sell down their stakes, while remaining private.
